name: The Filthy Cow
comment: Just ask the staff and there happy to let you use the restrooms

name: The Filthy Cow
comment: Just ask the staff and there happy to let you use the restrooms

name: Richmond Tea Rooms
comment: Assume just for customers, but is an lgbt run business, so may accommodate

name: Ban Di Bul
comment: It is an accesible toilet but there is a short set of stairs at the entrance of the restaurant. Need to be a paying costumer.

name: Afflecks Arcade, 35-39 Oldham St, Manchester M1 1JG, UK
Barburrito
comment: If it's busy enough they won't notice you walk through!

name: Turtle Bay
comment: you would have to be a paying customer, but i’m sure they’d let you go if u really needed to.

name: Merseymade
comment: Open to the public 7 days a week.

name: Bold Street Coffee
comment: 2 toilet stalls marked female, 1 toilet stall marked male and a stall with a urinal marked male.

name: University of Liverpool Guild of Students
Liverpool Guild Sphinx Bar
comment: Should be able to use regardless, many students go in and out without paying for anything

name: Liverpool Guild
comment: You do not have to be a paying customer to use these toilets - anybody can wander in and out. The Guild is open from 7am til 11pm every normal day.

name: Caffe Nero
comment: Easy to sneak in unnoticed and friendly staff

name: Caffe Nero
comment: Easy to walk in unnoticed and friendly staff

name: Itsu
comment: Customer toilet

name: MEATLiquor
street: Trinity Leeds Bank Street Behind Victoria’s Secret | Leeds | LS1 5AT
comment: Felt incredibly comfortable using the restroom here, all toilets are individual 'rooms' with male and female signs on the front, really impressed such a small establishment had gender neutral toilets, plus the food is pretty damn good too!

name: Pizza Punks
comment: They are a restaurant but very relaxed so will let you in

name: Flamingos Coffee House
comment: LGBT+ coffee house, super friendly and has a whole accessibility document on their website

name: Flamingos Coffee House
comment: Single large non-gendered cubicle in the back of Leeds’ only LGBTQ+ Coffee House

name: Global Tribe Crystals
comment: It’s polite to be a paying customer, but the staff are very lovely so probably wouldn’t mind you using the bathroom anyway :)

name: Caffé Nero
comment: Customer toilet - If you access it via the Albion Street side door, you don't have to go past the counter and it's on the left.

name: The light
comment: Toilet is only accessible by radar key. You can purchase one on amazon for about £4. Come in handy for a lot of disabled toilets. Great for a safe place!!!

name: Cafe Nero
comment: Probably need to buy a drink

name: Everyman Cinema, Level 4 Trinity
comment: It's usually quite busy, so you'll likely go unnoticed for using the bathroom only. There's a balcony near the bathrooms, so it could look like you're going there. People go to eat the pizza as well as for the cinema, and people often go to the bathroom before eating.

name: Kada's
comment: Independant persian cafe, so need to be a paying customer.  Not sure on the owners attitudes but if your looking for a gender neutral toilet its convient for leeds and is their only toilet.  Do a nice persian tea, food and sell shisha.

name: Costa Coffee
comment: You probably have to be a 'paying customer' but I've used this so many times without buying and they don't mind at all.

name: Henry Moore Institute
comment:
This is a free public bathroom.
Generally open 10am-5pm

name: Wharf Chambers
comment: Generally open after 5pm weekdays, 3pm on  weekends

name: Wharf Chambers
comment: You need to be a member (you can sign up online and it costs 1 pound) or the guest of a member to attend events.

name: Leeds City Museum
comment: Lower ground floor toilets are not unisex. Entry is free.

name: Cafe Bravo
comment: Paying customers toilet

name: Coventry Cathedral
comment: Friendly and welcoming staff. There is no charge to enter the cathedral. Stay to admire the amazing artwork, architecture and stained glass.

name: Herbert Art Gallery & Museum
comment: Museum is free, but awesome, so have a look round if you've got the time!

name: The quids Inn
comment: Never very clean, but is safe.

name: Alison Gingell Building
comment: University building with public access

name: Costa Coffee
comment: Customer toilet

name: Warwick University Sports and Wellness Hub
comment:
You do not need to be a paying customer.

Postcode: CV4 7EU

name: 9 Kenilworth Rd, Leamington Spa CV32 5TJ, UK
Balsall Common Library
comment: You can just walk in and use the toilet but feel free to browse through all the books

name: Costa Coffee - Balsall Common
comment: I'm not sure but you may have to be a paying customer, there are small snacks or bottled drinks if you have to buy something

name: M&S Simply Food
comment: Bin for medical swabs etc. Not sharps.

name: Warwickshire College, Royal Leamington Spa, Leamington Spa CV32 5JW, UK
comment: Have to be a student or at least get a visitor lanyard

name: Rugby College
comment: Students only

name: Costa coffe
comment: You will have to buy something

name: Starbucks
street: 1, Touchwood Court, 12 High St, Solihull B91 3TB
comment: Single stalls Male, Female, Disabled, Gender Neutral. If unlocked ask at the till. May need to purchase something.

name: Starbucks
street: 1, Touchwood Court, 12 High St, Solihull B91 3TB
comment: If locked, ask a member of staff to unlock for you - may need to purchase something.

name: Cardiff castle
comment: You have to be a paying customer

name: Cardiff castle
comment: You have to be a paying customer

name: Chance & counters
comment: You probably have to be a paying customer, but they might let you if you ask. No lifts available, narrow stairs. The door is quite hard to find.

name: Coffee #1
comment: Two seperate bathrooms, one accessible with baby changing, both unisex. Theoretically for customer use only, but this isn't enforced.

name: Greazy Vegan
comment: All gender toilet for customer use only. Sanitary bin provided.

name: Wow Bar
comment: Ask if you aren't buying anything.

name: The Queer Emporium
comment: Complete safe space

name: Slunks
comment: For salon clients only. Staff are friendly and helpful. The salon stock the toilet with various aerosol deodorants and sanitary products for customer use.

name: Little Man Coffee Co
comment: One appears to be large enough to be accessible, but the cafe itself has a step to get in, and the tables are cluttered around.

name: Wagamama (Cardiff Library)
comment: It's a restaurant, so you've got to buy something! I recommend the donburi for a whole meal, but gyoza are good for a little fast snacky thing to take away.

name: Student union foyer
comment: You don't have to be a student

name: Third floor student union
comment: You don't need to be a student to use this restroom

name: Cardiff University School of Chemistry (Main Building)
street: Cardiff University, Main Building, Park Place, CF10 3AT
comment: It is technically inside the School of Chemistry so may be locked outside of normal hours.

name: Cardiff University Student's Union
comment: Do not need to be a student

name: The Clink Restaurant
comment: For customers only. Possibly you could ask to use it if not a customer.

name: Arts and social studies library
comment: You do not need a student ID to get into the library during business hours, the barriers open automatically

name: The Playground Coffee House
comment: Down a steep set of stairs, no elevator.

name: OMG Bristol
comment: Nightclub. So only open after 6pm.

name: The Watershed
comment: Have inclusive bathrooms and are trans friendly

name: QueenShilling
comment: The Q/s has a female bathroom, and one labelled 'mans and gender neutral bathroom'. There is a cubicle in this and urinals a little further along, blocked from view by a partial wall.

name: Chance & Counters
comment: If you’re not a customer just ask at the bar

name: Chance & Counters
comment: Two gender neutral stalls.

name: The Watershed
comment:
They are a queer venue and advertise the loos as public bathrooms for anyone to use. There are many single cubicles all of which are gender neutral, some have sinks inside them and some don't. They have accessible loos and baby changing also.
Free sanitary producta are also available.

name: The Famous Royal Navy Volunteer
comment: Needs a radar key, though staff should let you in.

name: Arnolfini
comment: If anyone could check this out for me and update the entry that would be great. I'm not going to Bristol anytime soon.

name: Strange Brew
comment: Urinals, cubicals and a "women only" section

name: The Kitchen
comment: Signposted 'for customers'

name: Locked in a room
comment: You have to have payed to play not open to public

name: Ashton park school pupil toilets
comment: The only difference between these and the normal ones is they took the signs away

name: The station
comment:
useable no matter what, do not need to be attending an event/buying something.
There are singular stalls at the front and an accessible toilet at the back. 
Entirely gender neutral.

name: Dales
comment: Ykdickckx gfcfh

name: Alex
comment: This is a university building but you should be able to enter and leave without any problems. Just be confident.

name: Cargo Unit 2
comment: Ask for a code at any restaurants in the Cargo units.

name: Itsu customer toilets
comment: You have to be a paying customer as the password for the keypad is on the bottom of your receipt

name: Beacon House, University of Bristol
comment: Open to the public.

name: Sheffield Plate
comment: It's a food hall so there's no problem getting to the toilets without being a paying customer

name: Pret A Manger
comment: In my experience you can just walk in and use them as they’re usually super busy and don’t mind

name: Costa coffee, Orchard Square, Sheffield S1 2FB, UK
Marmadukes Cafe Deli
comment: You probably have to be a paying customer (I didn't check, sorry) but if in doubt just get a glass of tap water (it's free) and go right ahead. Or just grab a can of Coca Cola or something.

name: Owen building, Hallam university
comment: Building is open 8am to 9pm. Security sometimes check student IDs towards closing, but the rest of the day anyone can walk in without issue.

name: Howst Cafe
comment: Paying customer friendly cafe.

name: Street Food Chef
comment:
Probably customers only, but they're unlikely to stop you.
Stall is large, but doesn't have rails so unknown accessibility. 
The food is good too.

name: AsylumHub Café
comment: Gendered by sign but staff are LGBTQIA+ inc Transgender and Ask for Sandy program runs for free sanitary products for anyone regardless of “apparent” gender.

name: Sheffield Hallam Students Union - hideout bar
comment: Student bar but open to the public most days (unless a special event is on).

name: National Videogame Museum
comment: Gender neutral toilet block and separate accessible toilet with changing table. Friendly staff for queer folk.

name: Costa Coffee
comment: Paying customers only (door code on receipt) but door code may be C27384. Unsure about changing facilities

name: Costa Coffee
comment: Paying customers only (door code on receipt) but the door code may be C27384

name: Patriot Games
comment: Sells bored games and TCG games but if you ask the Patriot Games staff Nicely if you can use the toilet then they should allow u too.

name: The Diamond (University of Sheffield)
comment: Explicitly labelled as a gender-neutral inclusive toilet facility. There are a large number of single stalls.

name: Richard Roberts Building
comment: Look like a student.

name: Treehouse Board Games Cafe
comment: Accessible gender neutral single bathroom. There are more gendered toilets downstairs. Queer friendly venue.

name: University of Sheffield Students' Union
comment: Can walk in during the day, used during club nights as well but you won't get in at night without a ticket.

name: Costa Coffee
comment: Paying customer

name: Pivni york
comment: There are men, women's and gender neutral toilets to the rear of the 2nd floor

name: Jorvick
comment: You have to be visitinf the museun to use the toilets

name: El Piano
comment: Friendly staff. Lip to navigate through patio doors.

name: Cosy Time
comment: Act like you're just going to take a seat

name: Goji Cafe
comment: Paying customers only

name: Spring Espresso
comment: The best coffee in York with one non-gendered stall at the rear

name: York Art Gallery
comment: Entry to the main galleries is free. There's a focus on the queer aspects of the collection, which is refreshing

name: Costa Coffee
comment: In my experience, you don't have to buy anything but I would recommend it

name: York Explore Library
comment: there is a disabled toilet and a baby changing room. both serve as single-occupancy gender-neutral toilets

name: Random Encounter
comment: Single stall bathroom. Gender neutral. Free for anyone to use. Cafe is an LGBT safe space.

name: Fibbers
comment: You have to pay for entrance

name: Minster Inn
comment: Lovely pub 3 stalls female neutral and male no-one honestly gives a shit. And you have a few regular trans crowds that drink in there

name: Cafe 68
comment: Must be paying customer, but the cakes are amazing.

name: Yorkshire MESMAC York Office
comment: You need to ring to enter and this is the home of York LGBT Forum!

name: Pig and Pastry
comment: This is a really lovely place for a coffee and a queer friendly meet up!

name: Public wc
comment: 40p entry

name: National railway museum
comment: Museum is free

name: Made in Belfast
comment: Very safe restrooms, stalls are like an individual room

name: Starbucks
comment: You have to be a paying customer. Bathroom code is always tomorrow’s date in day/month format. E.g., on 22nd of March, passcode is 2303

name: Fish City
comment: You would need to be a paying customer

name: Wagamama
comment: Have to be a paying customer getting food

name: Fish City
comment: Marked with male and female signage, disabled single stall.

name: The Green Room in The Black Box
comment: Only the Green Room has specificallygender neutral toilets. In the Black Box main room, there is an accessible toilet but it isn't specifically gender neutral.

name: Ulster Museum
comment: Free entry to museum. Toilet located on ground floor.

name: Euro Spar Donegal Road
comment: You technical have to be a paying customer, but if you act like you are browsing for a moment you should be fine, staff are polite and kind

name: The Dock Cafe,
street: 2K Queen’s Road, Belfast BT3 9DT, United Kingdom

name: Euro Spar Shankill Road
comment: Technically have to be a paying customer, but staff don't take issue. There are men's, women's and an accessible restroom
Nice little vegan cafe run by lovely people.

name: Costa, George Square, Glasgow
comment: The code to access this toilet is on the bottom of your receipt

name: University of Strathclyde Student Association
comment: Only for students (of most universities granted), but only check student IDs once there is a bouncer on the door after around mid-afternoon.

name: University of Strathclyde Union
comment: You technically need to be a Strath student (or have one sign you in), but this is only an issue in the late afternoon/evening. During the day it's unlikely anyone will question you going in.

name: Doghouse
comment: Ideally for customers but if it’s too quiet to go in undetected then just ask a member of staff, they are friendly and accommodating.

name: DLC Hairdressing
comment: You have to be in for a haircut to use the bathroom and it's a pricey place but it's very LGBT friendly!

name: EAT
comment: Paying customers only.

name: EAT
comment: Paying customers only

name: Stereo
comment: This place is very near central station, and is great if you are stuck in town shopping or whatever,and not near the lgbt triangle and the coffee is great.

name: Buchanan galleries
comment: Make sure no security is looking and press the button to access the disabled area and act natural lol

name: City of Glasgow college
comment: Anyone can you the toilets on the ground and second floors but the rest are for students only

name: Costa St Enoch Centre
comment: You can easily use the downstairs stall without purchasing anything as it's in the extra seating area which is accessible by a separate door.

name: The Flying Duck
comment: One room is urinals, one is just stalls

name: The Locale
comment: Explicitly trans friendly pub

name: George Moore Building, Glasgow G4 0BA, UK
comment: Two single-stall rooms featuring male and female signage.

name: The Hub, University of the West of Scotland
comment: This building is open to the public. You do not need to be a student to use this toilet.

name: The Vic Cafe and Bar
comment: don't have to be a customer

name: Glasgow Disability benefits centre
comment: Available for patients/claiments and family who have an appointment.
